Node.definition: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= action by which humans acknowledge the elevated status of deities and give expression to that
= action by which humans publicly admit their own shortcomings before God, or the shortcomings of the people they represent
literally: name; hence: = the core of one's identity, which reflect the essence of one's being

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their actions
= state in which deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their actions
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= a pile of stones, ► sometimes used as a memorial for an important event

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state in which an area has been made inaccessible and strong, beyond the reach of others, such as enemies, ◄ usually by surrounding it by a high wall
= building or part of a building that has been fortified to provide additional security; often connected to the palace
= a person considered as not belonging to a certain group, be it religious, ethnic, or social

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one
= action by which humans, deities, or animals treat other humans, deities, times, or objects with honor and respect
= state in which a person, animal, substance, or force has the ability to exert great force

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= state in which a person is a strong and powerful enemy, who is thinks high of himself and is prone to violence, and usually does not fear God

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear

= large fortification; for the defense of a town; built of stone; could consist of one extra strong building or of a complex of buildings surrounded by its own strong wall; ≈ associated with protection and security and often used as an epithet for God
= a person or class of people that lack the means to support themselves; ≈ thereby often despised or mistreated, but being under God's protection

= large fortification; for the defense of a town; built of stone; could consist of one extra strong building or of a complex of buildings surrounded by its own strong wall; ≈ associated with protection and security and often used as an epithet for God
= person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= person in whom one has put one's trust; ◄ because of difficult circumstances; ► in order to find protection or safety
= process by which copious amounts of water flow from the skies, often accompanied by strong winds and having a destructive effect
= state of high temperature during the day; ◄ caused by the heat of the sun; ≈ regarded as uncomfortable
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
= state in which a person is a strong and powerful enemy, who is thinks high of himself and is prone to violence, and usually does not fear God
= process by which copious amounts of water flow from the skies, often accompanied by strong winds and having a destructive effect
= flat construction, ◄ normally made of stone, ► used as a divider of spaces, or to enclose a space
= state of high temperature during the day; ◄ caused by the heat of the sun; ≈ regarded as uncomfortable
= land in which there is a lack of water or rainfall; ► resulting in lack of vegetation and other desert like conditions, ≈ associated with thirst and hardship

literally: roaring; hence: = process by which a political entity, like a nation or kingdom, is in a state of unrest, often meaning that they are contemplating rebellion or planning to wage war; ◄ described in terms of the sound produced by turbulent waters
= a person considered as not belonging to a certain group, be it religious, ethnic, or social
literally: to humble; hence: = causative process by which humans or deities bring (other) humans and areas under their authority and control, usually using force
= state of high temperature during the day; ◄ caused by the heat of the sun; ≈ regarded as uncomfortable
= mass of visible, condensed watery vapor floating in the air; ► producing rain; ≈ God is said to envelop himself with clouds
= action by which one expresses utters words at a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not
= state in which a person is a strong and powerful enemy, who is thinks high of himself and is prone to violence, and usually does not fear God
literally: to be bowed down; hence: = process by which an activity is forcefully put to an end

Node.gloss: to cause to happen|to bring about
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause events to take place without them having to necessarily be involved in the event itself
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
literally: drinking; hence: = a banquet meal or feast with honored guests
literally: fat; hence: = state in which land or food is of an exceedingly good quality
literally: drinking; hence: = a banquet meal or feast with honored guests
= wine that has reached the most fully developed stage in the fermentation process
literally: fat; hence: = state in which land or food is of an exceedingly good quality
= state in which a dish contains a large quantity of marrow, ≈ which is considered to be a delicacy
= wine that has reached the most fully developed stage in the fermentation process
= process by which some element is purged of less pure elements

= causative action by which deities or humans cause other humans and objects to be removed from existence in a violent way, as if by swallowing up, either by direct intervention or by accomplishing this through the hands of others
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= piece of cloth ► used to cover a corpse before burial; ≈ associated with death and sorrow
= a large piece of cloth used as a covering, as on a bed, but also in a more figurative sense to signify a condition that affects people, as if they are covered by it
read סכך (סכך)

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural

= causative action by which deities or humans cause other humans and objects to be removed from existence in a violent way, as if by swallowing up, either by direct intervention or by accomplishing this through the hands of others
= process by which humans or animals stop living
poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future
= causative action by which humans clean or dry an object or body part by rubbing it with a cloth or with their hands; sometimes extended to refer to God; ≈ sometimes associated with destruction
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= fluid appearing in the eye; ≈ primarily associated with grief and mourning
= state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

Node.gloss: to look for|to wait for|to hope for
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to look for|to wait for|to hope for
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time
mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success
literally: hand; hence: = process by which humans or deties engage in an act of violence against (other) humans
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= causative action by which humans separate grain from straw by having animals trample it or by dragging a threshing board over it; ≈ often used figuratively to denote acts of aggression
= a nation and its territory; ◄ situated E. of Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) regarded as founded by a son of Lot (לֹוט)
= causative action by which humans separate grain from straw by having animals trample it or by dragging a threshing board over it; ≈ often used figuratively to denote acts of aggression
= dried stalks of harvested grain
= pile or pit with manure
= action by which humans or animals spread out part of their body

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
= action by which humans or animals spread out part of their body
= action by which humans move forward through water with the help of their arms and legs
= action by which humans move forward through water with the help of their arms and legs
= state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= movement of one's hands through water as of a swimmer
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
= area that has been fortified with the help of a strong and solid wall and possibly other defense works; ≈ associated with security
= a high and therefore unattainable location, either because of its natural environment or as a result of human construction efforts, ≈ associated with security and protection from the enemy

= structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside
literally: to goes to reach (the ground); hence: = causative action by which deities cause a high building to be completely destroyed until only rubble remains; ≈ associated with total humiliation

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface
